body_html: I also get the similar error trying to restore graph with tf.train.ExponentalMovingAverage. The error is ValueError: graph_def is invalid at node u'conv1_1/bn/ExponentialMovingAverage/AssignMovingAvg': Input tensor 'conv1_1/bn/conv1_1/bn/moments/moments_1/mean/ExponentialMovingAverage:0' Cannot convert a tensor of type float32 to an input of type float32_ref.
body_text: I also get the similar error trying to restore graph with tf.train.ExponentalMovingAverage.  The error is ValueError: graph_def is invalid at node u'conv1_1/bn/ExponentialMovingAverage/AssignMovingAvg': Input tensor 'conv1_1/bn/conv1_1/bn/moments/moments_1/mean/ExponentialMovingAverage:0' Cannot convert a tensor of type float32 to an input of type float32_ref.
body: I also get the similar error trying to restore graph with `tf.train.ExponentalMovingAverage`.  The error is `ValueError: graph_def is invalid at node u'conv1_1/bn/ExponentialMovingAverage/AssignMovingAvg': Input tensor 'conv1_1/bn/conv1_1/bn/moments/moments_1/mean/ExponentialMovingAverage:0' Cannot convert a tensor of type float32 to an input of type float32_ref.`
